summary: A tutorial on connecting Samsung Smart TVs to Alexa using the SmartThings app.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a blue polo shirt and a black cap with a brown patch, seated in a room illuminated by purple lighting. The background includes a computer setup with a monitor displaying a moon image, a gaming PC with visible fans, and a 'Keep Calm' poster. The man appears to be speaking, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. The scene transitions to a graphic with the text 'HelpCloud' on a teal background, surrounded by icons representing various services. The video then returns to the man, who continues to speak and gesture, maintaining the same setting and lighting throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker introducing how to link a Samsung Smart TV with Alexa using the SmartThings app. He maintains an excited tone as he invites the listener to stick around. He then welcomes listeners to the tutorial and states that there's a video on how to link your Samsung Smart TV within the Alexa home system. The speaker discusses limitations in controlling older TV models and explains that Samsung has updated the app and now provides more control for TVs from 2018 or newer. He provides a link to Samsung's website for additional information on level of integration. Before proceeding, the speaker recommends removing any previous setup of skill and accounts and removing the TV from the SmartThings app to start fresh. The speaker expresses that we should go ahead and just jump right in.

events_list.video_caption: The video shows a television screen displaying a "No Signal" message on a blue background, indicating that there is no input connected to the HDMI port labeled "HDMI 2." The message includes a button labeled "Sources," suggesting that the user can select a different input source. The TV is placed on a dark-colored stand in a dimly lit room, with a smartphone mounted on a stand in front of the TV, possibly for recording or streaming purposes. The environment appears to be a living room or entertainment area, with a focus on the TV and the smartphone setup. The scene remains static throughout the video, with no visible changes or movements.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker recommending that a TV be connected to a wireless network rather than a wired one, stating that "with wireless, the connection stays active," and explains that ethernet ports turn off on wired connections. The speaker has a conversational, informative tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a smartphone mounted on a stand, displaying the SmartThings app interface. The phone screen initially shows the SmartThings welcome page, indicating that the latest version is installed, with options for permissions, terms of service, privacy policy, and opening the SmartThings app. A hand appears, interacting with the screen by tapping on the 'Open SmartThings' option. The scene transitions to the SmartThings settings page, where various options such as 'Linked services,' 'Auto add Bluetooth devices,' and 'Change device on network' are visible. The hand then navigates to the 'My home' page, displaying sections for 'Master bedroom,' 'Living room,' and 'Directly connected devices,' with a background image of a plant. The background of the video features a blurred television screen with a blue hue, creating a dimly lit, cozy atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker explaining how to connect a TV to a wireless network and how to use the SmartThings app, emphasizing the importance of having the app updated. He then mentions setting up a SmartThings account. His tone is instructional. Finally, he indicates that the process will lead to the home screen.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person interacting with a smartphone mounted on a stand in a dimly lit room, with a television in the background displaying a login screen. The smartphone screen initially shows a home automation app interface titled "My home," listing rooms and devices. The user navigates to the "Add device" section, selecting "By device type" and then "TV" from the options. The app prompts the user to turn on the TV using the remote control, with a visual representation of the remote control on the screen. The user selects "My home" as the location for the TV and proceeds to the next step, which involves turning on the TV. The video captures the user's interaction with the app, highlighting the process of adding a TV device to the home automation system.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker with an informative and instructional tone, explaining how to add a device by tapping a plus sign and selecting from a list, such as a TV, noting that there might be regional lockouts and a support button for device information. He then transitions into guiding the listener to set up the TV, mentioning steps like choosing a location and room, and turning on the TV, waiting for communication between devices to request a pin code. A background ambient noise suggests an indoor environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a smartphone mounted on a stand, displaying a screen with a message that reads, "1 device was found. Select the device you want to add. You can see the device name below." The background features a television screen with a blue gradient and a white icon in the center. The smartphone screen then transitions to a numeric keypad, prompting the user to "Check the number shown on your TV, then enter it on your smartphone." A hand appears, interacting with the keypad, entering numbers, and then switching to a virtual keyboard to type "Done." The screen then shows a message stating, "Almost there you are! Fly being rendered to your device in seconds." Finally, the screen displays a message that reads, "Successfully connected. My home - Living room," with a virtual keyboard visible at the bottom. The background remains consistent throughout, with the television screen displaying a blue gradient and a white icon.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one male speaker noting a device being found on the network. He explains that it may be named "TV Challenger" or another name if it was renamed from the factory default. He directs the listener to tap the device and notes it says "connecting to your TV." He then describes that the listener should check the PIN shown on the TV and enter it on the phone, acknowledging the PIN is in the upper right hand corner. He dictates the PIN code and explains that it should be typed in before instructing the listener to tap "done". He mentions the TV is being registered to a Samsung account and that it has been successfully connected. He states the user can either keep the default name of the TV or change it, and he decides to change it to "living room." He then acknowledges they successfully added it into the SmartThings App.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a modern living room setting with a focus on a smartphone mounted on a stand in the foreground. The phone's screen displays a user interface with a message that reads, "Close your eyes on TV while watching your phone," accompanied by a heart icon and a list of connected devices, including "Living room 1" and "Directly connected devices." In the background, a television screen is visible, showing a blurred image with the text "DIRECTLY CONNECTED" at the bottom, indicating a connection status. The room is dimly lit, with a plant visible to the right of the phone, adding a touch of greenery to the scene. The overall atmosphere suggests a demonstration of a smart home or entertainment system, emphasizing the seamless integration of devices for an enhanced viewing experience.
events_list.audio_caption: A single male speaker explains that they are going to link SmartThings with the Alexa app using the SmartThings skill in Alexa. He instructs the listener to download the Alexa app from the Play Store or App Store if they haven't already. The speaker has an informative tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person interacting with a smartphone mounted on a stand in front of a television screen. The person navigates through various apps and settings on the phone, including the Google Assistant, which is highlighted for its voice control capabilities. The television in the background displays a login screen, indicating that the phone is likely being used to control the TV. The person types in the search bar, exploring different options and functionalities, such as sending messages and searching for specific apps. The environment is dimly lit, focusing attention on the phone and the television screen. The video showcases the ease of use and versatility of the smartphone's interface, particularly in controlling smart home devices and accessing information through voice commands.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker offering instructions, suggesting to use the Alexa app and browse the "skills" option. He mentions tapping the magnifying glass and typing "smart things". A click sound is heard as he clarifies to use the "smart things" option, not "smart things classic". His tone is instructional and straightforward.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a smartphone mounted on a stand, displaying the SmartThings app interface. The phone is positioned in front of a television screen, which is slightly out of focus. The app interface initially shows a welcome message with a button labeled "SIMPLE TO USE" and a brief description of the app's features. The user interacts with the phone, navigating through the app to a login screen that offers options to sign in with a Samsung account or a SmartThings account. The user selects the "DB" option, which seems to be a placeholder or a test account. The screen then transitions to a blank white page, indicating a loading or error state. Throughout the video, the background remains consistent, with the television screen displaying a blurred image and the room dimly lit, creating a focused atmosphere on the smartphone and its interaction with the SmartThings app.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker explaining a technical process, instructing the listener to "tap on where it says enable to use." He then explains that the next step involves signing in with the Samsung account that was used to add the TV to the SmartThings app, emphasizing the importance of using the same account for device syncing. He prompts the listener to "sign in with Samsung account" and "punch that information in." The speaker's tone is instructional and clear.

events_list.video_caption: The video shows a smartphone mounted on a stand in a dimly lit room, with a television in the background displaying a loading screen. The phone screen initially shows an authentication prompt for "SmartThings" with the Amazon Alexa logo, offering options to "Authorize" or "Deny." A hand appears, pointing at the "Authorize" button, and then taps it. The screen transitions to a message stating, "Your SmartThings account has been successfully linked," with a "Close" button below. The background remains consistent throughout, with the television screen showing a loading icon and the room's ambiance unchanged.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a single male speaker explaining a process, saying "Once you've got your credentials" with an informative tone. He continues to describe clicking on "authorize" to allow Amazon Alexa access. He then notes the successful linking of a SmartThings account.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a smartphone mounted on a stand, displaying a screen that reads "ACCOUNT LINKING" with a message stating "Your SmartThings account has been successfully linked." The background features a television screen with a blue gradient and a loading icon. The time on the phone reads 11:21. A hand appears and taps the "CLOSE" button, transitioning the screen to a new page titled "Discover Devices," which instructs the user to press a button on their device to connect. The hand then taps the "DISCOVER DEVICES" button, changing the screen to a blue background with the text "Alona is looking for devices to connect..." and a progress bar indicating the process may take up to 45 seconds. The time on the phone changes to 11:24. The video continues with the smartphone still mounted on the stand, displaying the same blue screen with the message "Alona is looking for devices to connect..." and the progress bar. The background remains consistent with the television screen showing a blue gradient and a loading icon. The time on the phone remains at 11:24, and there are no visible changes or actions in the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker explains the next step involves closing a window to "discover smart home devices" that can be controlled with Alexa. The speaker clicks on "close," opening a new window where he indicates the option to "discover devices," noting it may take up to 45 seconds for the device to be detected. The speaker then suggests that if the device isn't discovered, to unlink and remove everything, reattempting the setup. He expresses hope that the process succeeds in identifying the living room TV.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a smartphone mounted on a stand, displaying a screen with the message "1 TV found and connected" in white text on a blue background. The phone is positioned in front of a television, which is also turned on and displaying a similar message, indicating a successful connection between the two devices. The room is dimly lit, with a blue hue emanating from the television, creating a cozy atmosphere. The smartphone screen also features a "SETUP" button at the top, suggesting that the user can proceed with further configuration. The overall scene conveys a sense of technological integration and ease of use in a home entertainment setup.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker expressing satisfaction and reporting that the TV has been found and connected, stating "one TV found and connected". He continues, informing someone that their TV has been added to their Alexa account and instructs them to continue setting up their device, his tone is upbeat and helpful. Immediately following his speech, there is silence.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a smartphone mounted on a stand, displaying a setup screen for a smart TV. The screen shows a message indicating that one TV has been found and connected, with options to add the TV to a group or skip this step. The background features a TV screen with a blue gradient and a loading icon. The scene transitions to the smartphone screen showing the TV is set up and ready to use, with a message about the Living Room TV being set up and ready to use. The TV screen in the background remains unchanged. The next scene shows the smartphone screen displaying a list of devices, including lights and other smart home devices, with the TV screen in the background still showing the blue gradient and loading icon. The video then shifts focus to the TV screen, which displays a message indicating no signal on HDMI 2, with instructions to check the cable connection and settings of the source device and to press the source button on the remote to select the correct source. The TV screen remains black, indicating no signal, and the background is dimly lit with a blue hue. The video concludes with the TV screen still displaying the no signal message, with the background remaining dimly lit and blue.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker explaining how to control a device. He first states that, "now you can control the device, just like any other smart device and organize it as well." Then, he begins to demonstrate control features. The clip then transitions to examples of verbal commands given to Alexa, where the man tells Alexa to turn off the TV. He continues by telling Alexa to set volume, and switch the input to HDMI1. He then acknowledges that there's "a little bit more control on what I can do."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of a television screen displaying a user interface for a streaming service. The interface features a variety of options, including Netflix, Disney+, YouTube, Prime Video, IMDb TV, and more, with a promotional banner for the movie "Wayne" at the top. The background of the interface is dark, with a blue hue, and the text is predominantly white, making it easy to read. The scene then transitions to a person wearing a blue shirt and a dark cap with a yellow patch, sitting in a room with a computer setup in the background. The room is dimly lit with purple lighting, and there are two lamps on either side of the person. The computer setup includes a monitor, a desktop tower with visible fans, and a shelf with various items. The atmosphere of the room is cozy and tech-oriented, with a "Keep Calm" poster visible on the wall behind the person. The video captures the shift from a digital interface to a personal, tech-savvy environment, highlighting the connection between streaming content and the viewer's personal space.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker referring to a previous video, noting that, previously, he was only able to turn his TV on and off, without controlling volume, inputs, or channels. He notes that the SmartThings app update enables some of these controls on his 2018 TV, but not launching apps, which he infers to be a feature of 2019 or newer TVs. The speaker states he will leave a link in the video description to supported models and integration levels to check if the viewer's TV is on the list and can be controlled. Finally, the speaker concludes that it's a pretty smooth process to link systems together.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a blue polo shirt and a black cap with a brown patch, seated in a room illuminated by purple lighting. Behind him, a computer setup with a monitor displaying a sunset image and a gaming PC with glowing purple fans is visible, along with two lamps emitting a soft purple glow. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and hand gestures. A red 'SUBSCRIBE' button appears in the lower left corner of the screen, encouraging viewers to subscribe to his channel. The scene transitions to a promotional graphic with a teal background, featuring a white circle and the text 'MORE GREAT VIDEOS' in white, accompanied by two blank rectangles and arrows pointing towards them, suggesting additional video content. The word 'SUBSCRIBE' is displayed in an orange box below the circle, reinforcing the call to action for viewers to subscribe. The video concludes with this promotional graphic, maintaining the same layout and design elements.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker wrapping up a tutorial, thanking viewers, hoping they enjoyed it and got their tasks completed. He encourages them to like, share, subscribe, and visit their online shop for merchandise. He ends with "Peace." Following the speech, there is upbeat electronic music with a dance vibe. The music features synthesized sounds and is the only sound present during that time.
